comment: I recommend taking him online ONLY if you have had previous experience in AutoCAD or Excel. It was very easy for me to follow the videos from 2013 but I got work completed!! If you're not willing to ask for help, then don't take him. He is very flexible with grading and if you have any problems, he will set time for you to call you and explain.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: uses softwares in his videos from well over 10 years ago so its  super confusing but a good overall professor

He doesn't take the time himself to make the videos for the instructions, instead he uses videos from 2004-2013. The software has changed so much since then and just hard to follow. Its not a hard class to make a decent grade in but if you are trying to learn anything at all for your major, DO NOT TAKE HIM. Its just not a great experience overall.
Dr Hussein is a great professor. He makes time for his students and really cares about their success.

Dr. Abaza is an easy A but not a good professor. He expects his students to know AutoCAD already coming into the class and he uses instruction videos that are anywhere from 7-17 years old. He will gladly answer any question but ultimately did not teach me anything. His provided tools in AutoCAD are so screwed up and old it took me 30 min to fix it.

This guy is not only a good professor, but a really awesome person. He is super helpful, and seems like he loves answering questions. He makes his classes suuuper easy to pass, not a harsh grader at all. For my particular class he didn't grade on attendance. Probably one of the only college courses I've taken that gave me zero stress.

Professor Abaza is one of the best CM professors at Kennesaw. He is really nice and is very helpful if you need it. He posts all of the assignments for the semester so you can work at the pace you want. I finished in about 5 weeks. There are also 2 exams that if you do your assignments, you will get an A.
He is an awesome professor. He really cares about his students. I would def. take him again.
Professional and hardworking professor! Represents KSU the right way! Enjoyed taking his class and would recommend it to others.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Good guy but just a terrible teacher. His lectures make absolutely no sense and when you ask for help he can't really explain what you need him to. TONS of assignments that he always gives 100s on, but the tests are really hard since no one knows what he wants. You'll pass if you do the assignments, but take someone else if you can.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Best professor I've had thus far at SPSU. Don't skip often or you'll get behind. He is genuinely cares about your understanding of the material and only gives a midterm and a final; however, the assignments will break you if they are not done. I wish he taught the whole degree. Textbook mandatory for 2000 not one for 3000.

great professor always willing to help and guide you along through out the course. most work can be done in class hardly every do you have to take it home. definitely recommend his classes are great i would take him for all my CM classes if i could
Awesome professor, great way to start in Construction management. I wish all teachers were lik Dr. Abaza. Take him for any class he teaches.
Awesome professor and very helpful. I actually learned a lot in this class. The assignments are interesting and challenging but you have more than enough time to complete them.
This professor is good but he tends to be more concerned with those that have been in the industry than those that have not.

This guy rocks!  Super nice and willing to teach. It's like he really wants you to learn the material and is eager to explain and go beyond that of what you asked him about. He has a great attendance policy - you miss so many days you get grade deduction but he lets you do bonuses to gain the points back.
Good Professor, and is very helpful with class exercises.

The instructional handouts are from outdated software so it often stumps the students for too long of periods.  This causes the professor to be in high demand for individual assistance.  That in turn keeps others held back while waiting for him.
Great teacher!! Very smart too!!
He is the Best I ever had in CM
Great professor!!!! Extreme patience with his students. One of the best professors Ive ever had!
Wonderful teacher, genuinely interested in you learning.  Easy class but you learn alot.  Funny guy!
excellent teacher with amazing patience
Interesting guy.  He let's the students make a lot of the decisions.  Not hard though.
No Comments
No Comments
